name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Irongrip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pok√©mon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing its victim around and toss it hard.

strengths: Irongrip can paralyze on coin flip
Grass type is effective against Water Pokemon
weaknesses: 60 HP is fragile for a main attacker
Fire weakness is problematic against Fire decks
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - helps reach Guillotine cost
counters: Charizard - Fire type with high damage

competitiveHistory: Pinsir from Jungle was not considered competitively viable. With only 60 HP as a Basic Pokemon, it was too fragile compared to the Haymaker staples like Hitmonchan (70 HP) and Scyther (70 HP with resistance). The coin-flip paralysis on Irongrip was unreliable, and Guillotine's 4-energy cost was inefficient. Scyther was simply a better Grass-type option for competitive play due to its free retreat, Fighting resistance, and Colorless energy costs.

rulings.ruling: Irongrip's coin flip for Paralysis happens after damage is dealt.
If the Defending Pokemon is already Paralyzed, flipping heads on Irongrip has no additional effect (Paralysis doesn't stack).
